channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Problem gambling pushed underground amid Covid-19 circuit breaker
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

With nowhere to go given the Covid-19 circuit breaker, most residents in the quiet Boon Lay neighbourhood had settled in for the night. But one resident and his friends invited some strangers - including The Straits Times - to a "friendly game" of Pok Deng, a Thai card game, at what looked to be a two-room flat last month.

item.title: Do I have to wear a face shield and how do I clean it?
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Face shields can be used in situations where it is impractical to use a face mask and where safe distancing can be maintained.

item.title: 4-vehicle crash: Drug suspect arrested for dangerous driving
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A 34-year-old man was arrested for dangerous driving and suspected drug-related offences after an accident in Bedok North Road involving three cars and a lorry on Tuesday night.

item.title: Primary 1 registration goes entirely online in view of Covid-19 situation
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Registration for children starting Primary 1 next year will have to be done online in view of the Covid-19 situation, the Ministry of Education (MOE) said yesterday.

item.title: SPC resists pump price hikes after others raised rates over a week ago
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

In an unusual move, Singapore Petroleum Co (SPC) has kept its pump prices unchanged since May 6, bucking a trend which saw all other pump operators here raising prices a week after the last downward adjustment.

item.title: Don't cut foreign worker levels, say business groups
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Reducing the number of migrant workers in Singapore, in the light of the Covid-19 outbreak, will hurt Singapore's economic recovery and harm the job prospects of Singaporeans, several business groups and trade associations said yesterday.

item.title: Disrupted home renovation works can restart from June 2
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Renovation works for Housing Board flats and private homes that were disrupted can restart in phase one of the post-circuit breaker period, the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) said yesterday.

item.title: Companies still hiring amid economic slump
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Companies are still hiring in spite of the economic downturn.

item.title: Holding GE sooner will help Singapore tackle coronavirus crisis: DPM Heng
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore faces a crisis which poses major challenges that have to be dealt with over the next five to 10 years.

item.title: Coronavirus curbs delay school upgrading
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Precautionary measures to contain Covid-19 have affected upgrading works at Bukit View Primary, Mayflower Primary, Pei Hwa Presbyterian Primary and St Margaret's Primary schools.

item.title: Customer service associate learning new skills at packaging factory
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

While some industries find that they have excess manpower as operations slow down owing to coronavirus crisis measures, others have a lack of staff because customer demands have increased.

item.title: Covid-19 cases went to sites in Bukit Panjang, Jurong West
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Two FairPrice supermarkets in Bukit Panjang and a market and hawker centre in Jurong West have been added to the list of public places visited by Covid-19 patients before they were tested.

item.title: Cabby jailed for transmitting false message on Covid-19 closures
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A taxi driver posted a false message in a Facebook group, claiming he had received information that all foodcourts and coffee shops would close and supermarkets would open only two days a week.

item.title: Air stewardess tries her hand at supermarket retail
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

As the coronavirus crisis grounded flights and brought air travel to an almost complete halt, air stewardess Wendy Leong found herself out of work.

item.title: NTUC focusing on matching at-risk workers to companies
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

While technicians at an aerospace firm were facing the prospect of losing their jobs earlier this year, hard disk manufacturer Seagate was looking for similarly skilled workers.

item.title: 11 teens charged over unlawful assembly amid circuit breaker
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A 17-year-old girl was among 11 teenage Singaporeans who appeared in court yesterday for allegedly leaving their homes for a "settlement talk" despite circuit breaker measures. They are also accused of arming themselves with knives.

item.title: Covid-19 crimes: How some are adapting and finding new ways to scam, cheat and profit
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Gambling has gone underground, while scammers and loan sharks are trying to cash in on people's fears and vulnerabilities.

item.title: Search for new job a long, challenging process for some
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

When Ms Alvina Tan got a new job at a market research company in February, she braced herself for a few hectic months ahead.

item.title: $10 top-up of 44k foreign workers' prepaid phone cards for Aidilfitri
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 44,000 foreign workers here have each received a free $10 top-up of their prepaid SIM cards so they can call their families during the Hari Raya Aidilfitri period.

item.title: Drug syndicates get crafty as supply disrupted, prices spike
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Border closures and movement restrictions in many countries to stem the spread of Covid-19 are also hindering the global supply of illegal drugs, with law-enforcement agencies seeing an increase in street prices of some drugs as a result.

item.title: No shortage of vacancies in thriving tech, finance sectors
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

The job market has taken a big hit during the coronavirus pandemic, but technology and finance companies are still thriving and continuing to hire.

item.title: Beware two products with potent medicinal ingredients, HSA warns
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

The Health Sciences Authority (HSA) has warned the public to avoid buying or consuming two products as they contain potent medicinal ingredients that should not be used without medical supervision.

item.title: Spike in online scams as people stay home
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

With his family of five cooped up at home, John (not his real name) decided to splurge last month on a Nintendo Switch game console from a seller on Carousell.

item.title: 350 airport workers make temporary switch to new jobs
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Jeyaseelan Sundram had been greeting well-heeled travellers as a guest relations officer at the luxury JetQuay CIP Terminal in Changi Airport for the past two years.

item.title: New resources to help take care of migrant workers
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

New resources are now available to provide better care for migrant workers, including a mobile app to check and report their daily health status and a feature for their employers to track where they have been moved to amid the pandemic.

item.title: Illegal sex services continue as cash-strapped workers receive help
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Temperature screening before paid sex: This is a precaution that a Telegram group chat advertising sexual services has imposed on its clients.

item.title: Jobs for the longer term needed after the dust settles
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

That is where the new National Jobs Council headed by Senior Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam will have an important role to play.

item.title: Court rejects natural parents' objections and allows adoption
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

It was a dilemma: Return a five-year-old to his mother with drug-riddled prison records or let his foster parents adopt him.

item.title: Loan sharks turn to new tactics to harass debtors
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Loan sharks have been busy during the weeks of the circuit breaker, wasting no time in finding new, social distancing ways to harass their debtors to pay up.

item.title: Income eligibility for Courage Fund to be raised from June 1
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

The income criteria to qualify for the Courage Fund will be raised from June 1, so more households affected by the coronavirus outbreak can get help.

item.title: Facebook page, run by Alex Tan, asked to put up corrections to falsehoods on Pofma
item.description:
May 28, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Times Singapore Facebook page has been asked to put up corrections to a post in which multiple false and misleading statements were made about the scope and application of the Protection from Online Falsehoods and Manipulation Act (Pofma).
